subject: RE: [junit] Using JUnit with Kawa
msgSnippet: Dan, How are you using JUnit with Kawa?  Did you set it up with: http://www.junit.org/kawa.htm ?  Have you tried including junit.jar in your classpath env? --
messageBody:
Dan,

How are you using JUnit with Kawa? Did you set it up with:
http://www.junit.org/kawa.htm ? Have you tried including
junit.jar in your classpath env?

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org


-----Original Message-----
From: Dan MacKay [mailto:dmackay@...]
Sent: Wednesday, February 14, 2001 10:03 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Using JUnit with Kawa


Hi all,

Is anyone here using JUnit with Kawa and experiencing class not found
errors? My test suites run fine if I run JUnit outside of Kawa, or set the
classpath globally to include the path to my test directory then restart
Kawa.

Is there no way of setting the classpath on a per project basis? I have
already tried the project classpath option from inside of Kawa and setting
you test class output directory but for some reason it seems as if this
classpath is not getting set prior to executing JUnit.

Any suggestions would be appreciated.

Thanks,

Dan MacKay
